text: hello I'm Dylan a cloud engineer here at
the AWS office in Cape Town today I'll
show you how to use the reserved
instance coverage report in the AWS cost
Explorer let's get
started first log in to the AWS
Management console and navigate to the
billing and cost Management
console scroll navigation pane on the
left until you see the reservation
section click on the coverage report
option please note as a best practice
ensure that you're reviewing the correct
time period that you wish to
analyze you can use this report to view
and analyze the utilization of your
reserved instances you can view the
reserved instances utilization data in
hours or normalized units using this
dropdown
list the main chart shows the number of
instance hours or normalized units
covered by your reserved instances over
time this information can help you track
your required instance usage against the
coverage provided by your reserved
instances under the chart you can see a
table that shows the individual reserved
instances along with their coverage
details the coverage percentage column
shows what percentage of your usage is
covered by each reserved instance you
can select one or more reserved
instances in in this table to see their
combined coverage in the
chart a useful feature of this chart is
that you can set a Target coverage
percentage for your reserved instances
with this input field after you set this
value the chart shows a dotted line that
indicates your Target and you can now
identify workloads that need more
reserved instance
coverage it's a best practice to review
this report regularly as part of your
Cloud cost management
strategy and now you know know how to
use the reserved instance coverage
report in the AWS billing and cost
Management
console thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us at AWS
